data.title: New Balance 5th Avenue Mile
data.meta_description: Lace up your racing shoes for the 43rd running of the popular New Balance 5th Avenue Mile on Sunday, September 8.
data.text:
The Member-Only Standby List for the New Balance 5th Ave Mile is full. If you already submitted your name to the Member-Only Standby List for this event, you could be selected from the standby list and sent a non-complimentary invitation code up to 48 hours before the event date.

Active NYRR Members can read about the New Balance 5th Avenue Mile Member-Only Standby List here.

As part of our mission to help and inspire people through running, New York Road Runners offers more than 3,000 complimentary race entries annually through NYRR Race Free. For the 2024 program, we’ve received the allocated 1,000 qualified applications and the application process is now closed to the public. Please visit the NYRR Race Free page to learn more and consider applying for the 2025 program. The application period takes place once a year, and the 2025 timeline will be announced in mid-2024.

Numbers (which include your timing tag) may be picked up at the NYRR RUNCENTER featuring the New Balance Run Hub at 320 West 57th Street (between Eighth and Ninth avenues) on the following dates:

Sunday, August 25, 9:30 a.m. 5:00 p.m.

Monday, August 26, 9:00 a.m.–7:30 p.m.

Tuesday, August 27, 9:00 a.m.–7:30 p.m.

Wednesday, August 28, 9:00 a.m.–7:30 p.m.

Thursday, August 29, 9:00 a.m.–7:30 p.m.

Friday, August 30, 9:00 a.m.–7:30 p.m.

Saturday, August 31, 9:30 a.m. 5:00 p.m.

Sunday, September 1, 9:30 a.m. 5:00 p.m.

**The RUNCENTER will be closed on Monday, September 2 for Labor Day**

Tuesday, September 3, 9:00 a.m.–7:30 p.m.

Wednesday, September 4, 9:00 a.m.–7:30 p.m.

Thursday, September 5, 9:00 a.m.–7:30 p.m.

Friday, September 6, 9:00 a.m.–7:30 p.m.

Saturday, September 7, 9:30 a.m.–5:00 p.m.

Runners are encouraged to pick up their bibs at the RUNCENTER to avoid race day lines.

All participants will receive New Balance Shorts at number pickup. Your shorts size may not be available at the time of bib pick-up.

On race day, number pickup will be available from 5:50 a.m. to 12:15 p.m. at Race-Day Central (located in front of the Metropolitan Museum of Art on 5th Ave and 81st Street).

Show your race confirmation email or the QR code from your NYRR account to pick up your race materials. Proxy bib pickup is available for this race, so a friend or family member can pick up your race materials. The person will need the QR code for your NYRR account, along with a form of photo identification that corresponds to your NYRR account.

On race day, number pickup will be available from 5:50 a.m. to 12:15 p.m. at Race-Day Central (located in front of the Metropolitan Museum of Art on 5th Ave and 81st Street). Races will have separate start times for each age group, with the exception of the NYRR Road Mile Championships and the professional athlete heats. Please refer to the Schedule of Events for the start time of each heat and plan to pick up your bib close to the start time of your heat. Race participants must run in the heat assigned to them.

Show your race confirmation email or the QR code from your NYRR account to pick up your race materials. Proxy bib pickup is available for this race, so a friend or family member can pick up your race materials. The person will need the QR code for your NYRR account, along with a form of photo identification that corresponds to your NYRR account.

View the Full Course Map (with the Start Location )

The race will take a straight line down 5th Avenue, starting near East 80th Street and finishing near East 60th Street.

First quarter-mile (to 75th Street): The race begins on a slight downhill.

Second quarter-mile (to 70th Street): This segment features a slight uphill.

Third quarter-mile (to 65th Street): There's another gentle downhill in this segment.

Fourth quarter-mile (to 60th Street): The final five blocks are on a flat surface.

We strongly recommend checking mta.info before you travel. You can also message the MTA on WhatsApp.

Bag check will be available beginning at 6:20 a.m. close to the start and finish lines. You must pick up your bag at the location you dropped it off.

Planning to check a bag on race morning? While we will continue to have clear plastic bags available at number pickup, we encourage you to use your own clear reusable plastic bag, no larger than 17" wide x 20" high x 7" deep, with the tag affixed.

NYRR is not responsible for lost, damaged, or stolen bags or items from bags checked at NYRR bag check.

Entry into these heats is by invitation only; no entrant will be automatically placed in these heats. The minimum standards for inclusion in the NYRR Road Mile Championships are 4:20 for men, 4:50 for women, and 4:50 for non-binary categories. Times submitted must be from no earlier than April 1, 2023. For a gender category to have a NYRR Road Mile Championships heat, a minimum of five entrants with the qualifying standard are required prior to August 16, 2024. For consideration, contact eliteathletes@nyrr.org no later than that date.

Live, unofficial results will be available in the NYRR Racing App and at liveresults.nyrr.org during the event.

After the conclusion of the event, official results will be posted on results.nyrr.org.

For the pro field, awards will be presented on-site to the top men and women finishers.

For the NYRR Road Mile Championships, awards will be presented on-site to the top men and women finishers.

Runners who place in the top-three of their age group will be able to claim an award in the days following the race by filling out our Age-Group Awards Claim Form.

As a World Athletics Label race, the New Balance 5th Avenue Mile operates under World Athletics rules and is subject to all applicable rules and policies regarding prize money. Prize money is available in the Professional Athlete and NYRR Road Mile Championships heats, only. Entry into these heats is by invitation only; no entrant will be automatically placed in these heats. The minimum standards for inclusion in the NYRR Road Mile Championships are 4:20 for men, 4:50 for women, and 4:50 for non-binary categories. For a gender category to have a NYRR Road Mile Championships heat, a minimum of five entrants with the qualifying standard are required prior to August 16, 2024. For consideration, contact eliteathletes@nyrr.org no later than that date.

Prize Money for Invited Professional Athletes

Professional Athlete Heats

1st $5,000 2nd $3,500 3rd $2,500 4th $1,500 5th $1,000 6th $750 7th $500 8th $250

Halfway Leader Bonus: $1000 will be awarded to the halfway leader in the Professional Athlete heats. To collect this bonus, the halfway leader must finish the race in under 4:00 (men) or 4:32 (women). If they do not, the bonus will be awarded to the next-fastest runner at halfway who does break the above standards.

Prize Money for NYRR Member Division

NYRR Road Mile Championships Heats

To be eligible for prize money in the NYRR Road Mile Championships, an athlete must have had a valid paid NYRR membership since at least June 8, 2024 through at least the date of the race.

1st $400 2nd $300 3rd $200 4th $100
